review_title: Hard work, rewarding but under appreciated
job_title: Biomedical Support Worker in Cambridge, England
pros: There is always work available, there is almost always overtime present and also there is never a shortage of opportunities to work in many departments, it can be rewarding to directly make a difference to people's lives
cons: The pay does not increase with inflation, a few years ago, it increased by 1% and then it has not since. Managerial roles are filled for a long time so it is hard to progress past band 5 if you are not a midwife or doctor. Staff are often overworked, due to lack of funding for appropriate staff levels, this is not helped by staff being hindered in their role by endless paperwork that badly needs streamlining

review_title: Great job satisfaction marred by commute and bureaucracy
pros: Best aspect of my job was interacting  with patients and providing them with a life changing hearing implant
cons: The worse aspect was the NHS Trust at Addenbrookes preventing staff from parking in site and expecting them to use thief ridden park and ride sites. Within a  6 month period I had my bike saddle and front wheel stolen from my bike. After a stressful and busy 27 mile drive from Huntingdon, this made life very difficult. The bureaucracy involved in my job was also excessive and frequently unnecessary.

job_title: Health Care Assistant in Cambridge, England
pros: Job satisfaction is incredible because you are very necessary and important to the functioning of the hospital. It is also a good job if you have a complicated life. You can work anytime you want, whatever hours you are able. Even signing up at the last minute. Saturdays and nights are 1.5 pay, Sundays are double.
cons: The work can be stressful. Hospitals are sometimes very sad places. You have to be a careful and compassionate person, because a mistake can be dangerous to the patient.

review_title: One of the best NHS Trust to work for

cons: Promotion in Finance can be very challenging  and working in the same post may get boring after a year (or so).
